fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The check box option did not work when we click on the box to select a project role under people.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on *Project setting* >> *People.*
 # Try to add more than a project role via the check box option.

h3. Expected Results
This should mark as checked when we click on the check box option.
  
h3. Actual Results
The option will not be marked.
  
h3. Workaround
We need to click on the project role name.
  
This *[video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/mXu64gnE]* will show the behavior and workaround.
fields.summary: The check box option did not work when we click on the box to select a project role under people

fields.description: Availability to disable email notification after claiming accounts from domain due to not all users have access to Atlassian Cloud products.
fields.summary: Availability to disable email notification after claiming accounts from domain

fields.description:
When we select a project, using basic search, the scope of the search will be for this project. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
1. Open the Jira basic search.
2. Select a project, e.g.: "Project A".
3. Find by an Epic link from e.g.: "Project B" inserted into an issue in the "project A".
4. *Result*: this issue will not appear, neither the epic link option will be shown.

h4. Extra info
This seems to be a decision to improve the performance, however, I would like that Basic search should find issues beyond the project scope, as happens with the advanced search.

h4. Workaround
The workaround here is to use Advanced Search.
fields.summary: Basic search cannot find epic links from other projects when you select a project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A negative value in a custom number field will be shown as zero in the issue history.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom number field to an issue in a Jira Software or Service Desk project.
 # Put a positive number and a negative number here.
 # Check the issue history. The negative number will be always be shown as 0.

h3. Expected Results

The issue history should show the actual negative number as in the custom number field instead of 0.
h3. Actual Results

The issue history always shows 0 when there is a negative value in the custom number field.
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: A negative value in a custom number field will be shown as zero in the issue history.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Printing a Jira issue with a code snippet in the comment section and having many rows of code does not print correctly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a Jira Software or Service desk project
 # Insert a code snippet in the comment
 # Add a large number of rows(say 50+) in the code snippet. Make sure you have to scroll within a code snippet.
 # Click the Print option available in the 3 dots on the top right of the page to see the preview of the page.
 # The code snippet section size does not resize or respond to the data inside. You need to scroll to see the entire code data. Also, the print comes incorrectly.

h3. Expected Results

The code snippet section during print should resize as per the data inside.
h3. Actual Results

NA
h3. Workaround

After clicking the Print option, you can use the Inspect mode in Developer tools and modify the max-height of the table to a higher value. The default value shown is 30.

div.preformattedContent pre, div.codeContent pre

{ max-height: 30em; overflow: auto; white-space: pre-wrap; word-wrap: normal; }
fields.summary: Printing a Jira issue with a code snippet in comment and having many rows of code does not print correctly

fields.description: The log work window has a comment section that uses an old editor and not the new one. Since we will soon be shifting to New issue view permanently, modifying the editor in this window would also help.
fields.summary: Log work window has a comment section which uses old editor

fields.description: Our users would like to have the ability to reduce the size of a photo when taking a picture or uploading from photo library. They are out in the field and often do not have access to a wi-fi network. Uploading pictures to the Jira Cloud takes up too much of their data. There is no native way to reduce file size like there is when you send an email and it gives you the option to reduce the file size of the photo.
fields.summary: Ability to reduce file size of photo when attaching on mobile app

fields.description:
An inbuilt feature that can help schedule a backup of all the ISSUE data(without the limit of 1000 rows) which could later be used to retrieve the information when an issue is deleted without restoring the whole site.

Scheduled automated daily export of all Jira issues (100,000 + issues) to CSV output to…
 * Email
 * Confluence page attachment
 * Cloud storage location

The backup currently includes the entire site data and an Excel/CSV backup on daily basis can help the user retrieve any basic information in case of minute accidental change.
fields.summary: Daily scheduled export of all the issues in a jira site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Project role for Next-gen *Collaborate on issues (a set of permissions)* and *Create issues* doesn't work as mentioned in the [document|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/next-gen-permissions/].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to the site and provide only site access and *_no_* product access. 
 # Add this user to a custom group and map this group to the *Collaborate on issues (a set of permissions)* or *Create issues* project role of next-gen project.
 # Tag/mention this user in one of the issue of this next-gen project so that the user is notified. 
# User gets a notification email. When user click on *_View issue_* from the notification, user cannot access the site and prompts user to *request product access*.
# This way, user is unable to edit/delete own comments & attachments and cannot *view watchers* as well. User can only add comments and attachments by replying to the email notification that is received. 
# However when impersonated the user, user is able to access the project and its issues, and. can also add/edit/delete own comments & attachments.

h3. Expected Results

* User without having the product access, should be able to access the cloud site and the respective project and its issues.

h3. Actual Results

* User is unable to access the site and is prompted to *request product access*

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project role for Next-gen *Collaborate on issues (a set of permissions)* cannot be used for collaboration.

fields.description:
It would be nice to not to display the 'Delete' button for active Issue type scheme shch as Screen scheme or etc.

Current Isseu type schemes behave to show the 'Delete' button though the schemes are active. The behavior (or specification?) makes administrators take mistakes to delete active Issue type schemes.:( Surely, I understand it have the aleart comments before deleting; however, it is better to delete the 'Delete' button of active Issue type schemes.   

!image-2020-11-05-11-57-16-478.png!
fields.summary: Stopping deleting active Issue type schems

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user tries to associate a workflow into a workflow scheme, the workflows are not displaying in alphabetical order.
 !image-2020-11-04-17-59-00-455.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/945104532/953138831/1/1530296096612/cog.png|height=18! > *Issues*
# Click Workflow Scheme;
# Edit one existing workflow scheme;
# Click on "add Workflow" > Add Existing;

h3. Expected Results
Workflows are sorted alphabetically.

h3. Actual Results

Workflows are sorted alphabetically.

h3. Workaround

Use the ctrl + F / command + F and find the desired workflow.
fields.summary: Workflow names are not in alphabetical order in the workflow scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira issues get a resolved time during issue creation when a default resolution is set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a default resolution from https://<<CLOUD_URL>>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa
 # Add the resolution field to the issue creation screen.

h3. Expected Results
 # Issue is created with a resolution value and resolved time.

h3. Actual Results
 # Issue is created with a resolved time however the resolution field shows empty in the UI.
 # Also, when you query the issue in Issue navigation, the resolution value is not read and the issue shows up when you query.
{code:java}
 resolution is EMPTY{code}

h3. Workaround
 # Remove the resolution field from the issue creation screen.
fields.summary: Jira issues get a resolved time even at issue creation when a default resolution is set

fields.description: Ability to get Audit Log for Custom Fields, information on where the custom field is used across all the projects of the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to get Audit Log for Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary :

Ability to update slack status based on Jira ticket status
h3. Expected Results:

Automatically update personal status in Slack if the Jira ticket is "In-Progress"

Update the slack status as - 

<My workings hours> - <Tickets which I own and are in "In-Progress" state>

For example :

" Today I work from 10:00 to 19:00 - [JST-609066|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-609066] "

Where [JST-609066|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-609066] is aJira tickets with "in Progress" status
fields.summary: Ability to update slack status based on Jira ticket status

fields.description: Actually, it's not showing exactly the estimated time to generate a backup. It would be awesome to have this feature.
fields.summary: Show Estimated time to generated a backup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Create and Edit issue screens may fail to render in Jira if a user-picker field is displayed and the default value is set to a user that has been deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a user-picker field and set a user as the default value
 # Delete the user that has been set as default
# Attempt to edit an issue or create an issue in different projects.

h3. Expected Results
Create and Edit issue screens containing this field should continue to display properly and allow users to change the value to a different user as needed.

h3. Actual Results
The issue cannot be created. The following message is displayed even in projects where the field isn't present:

{quote}
<FIELDNAME>: User '<USER NAME>' is not valid for this user picker.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
* Re-create the user
* Change the default field value
fields.summary: User Picker fields may cause Issue Actions to Fail if Default Value is set to Deleted User

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

In *Configuring email notification for custom events* documentation, it doesn't mention that this would only send email notification to Jira (licensed) users. This could lead misunderstanding for users who configure this for their Jira Service Desk project and expect it to fire notification for JSD customers too.
* https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-email-notifications-for-a-custom-event/

h3. Suggested Resolution

Add additional information that this would only trigger for Jira (licensed) users / internal users (not for Jira Service Desk customers)
fields.summary: Add additional information that custom event is only triggered for licensed users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue navigator won't show the result on the issue key if the search string used is lengthy enough to enable the scroll option.

The output panel is pushed further down and is not accessible on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the Issue Navigator 
 # Type a lightly search text and hit search
 !Replicated.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The result set should be accessible on the page. 

h3. Actual Results

The output panel is not accessible.

h3. Workaround

Switch to the old issue view for now.
fields.summary: Filter output from the lengthy search text not accessible on the issue nav in the new issue view

fields.description:
At the moment Option list in Jira cloud can hit a ceiling on the amount of options that can be utilized. There is a limit of 10000 option list via rest apis and the custom field will be loading slow. 

*Suggestion* : Allow custom fields to utilize data from external sources to allow handling of larger data that will not impact the performance of the Jira site.
fields.summary: Custom field option list utilizing external data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding an existing Workflow to another they are listed randomly, they use to be listed alphabetically
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Workflow Schemes* 
 # Select Edit on one workflow scheme
 # Click Add Workflow > Add existing

h3. Expected Results
Previously the pop-up screen of the existing Workflows was alphabetically displayed 
h3. Actual Results
The list is displaying the existing workflows randomly:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When adding an existing Workflow to a workflow scheme they are listed randomly, they use to be listed alphabetically

fields.description:
Jira incoming mail handlers won't process e-mails whenever the "Auto-submitted" header is present in a message. 

Even if you change the "Bulk" options in the handler. The mentioned e-mails won't be processed at all.

h4. Why is this important?
Admins may want to create tickets in Jira based on auto-submitted e-mails coming from different sources.

h4. Suggested Solution
Provide an option of whether to accept or not the processing of "Auto-submitted" e-mails. Just like provided with the bulk option
fields.summary: Allow users to choose if "Auto-submitted" e-mails would be processed by mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user tries to use the shortcuts to create an issue clicking "c", access help clicking "?" *OR* using "/" to search is not working.
If you go into the "My Work" page it will work as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Jira
 # Try to type "c", "?" or "/"

h3. Expected Results
For "c" open the creation issue screen, for "?" open the shortcut help and for "/" go to the search nav bar

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create issue "c", access help "?" and search "/" shortcut is not working

fields.description: Since capabilities have target completion dates the roadmap should reflect that date (and corresponding iteration) on the capability color bar  - see screenshot. This shows at a glance which capabilities will be completed during the PI and which may need to extend into the next PI.
fields.summary: Roadmap should show capability iteration completion based on target completion date

fields.description: Results displayed via the search box on the top left should also display status(closed, in progress etc)  for issues as this would give better insights to users if the issue is resolved or being worked upon.
fields.summary: Quick search should display the status of the ticket along with the issue key in results
Ability to reset the workflow condition history

fields.description:
Dears; 

Can we block DDE CVEs using FireEye HX - Thanks
fields.summary: DDE CVE on HX

fields.description: Please work on getting a way to change the background color, or switching to dark mode. I'm staring at Jira for hours on end every day, and by the end of the day my eyes are absolutely fried. It's such a strong white light, even with my bluelight filter on, it just blasts your eyes. I'm sure a ton of people would appreciate it as well
fields.summary: Dark Mode

fields.description: We have a  2-way sync for defects between JiraAlign<>Jira. The 10 out-of-the-box defect states for JiraAlign do not match with Jira's "11500:Blocked" state. Adding a Blocked state to JA's defect would enhance our flow by calling out the blocker and seems like a natural fit.
fields.summary: Add defect state - BLOCKED

fields.description:
Customer would like to be able to configure the Board settings from the *Jira Mobile app* but as of now the option is not visible on both iOS and Android.

*Workaround:*

Logging in through the mobile web browser helps in configuring the board settings from the webpage.
fields.summary: Ability to configure board settings from the Jira Cloud Mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing the usage report for a project role the usage also counts inactive users ( users who don't have product access).

This confuses Jira admins as it does not add value to show users without product access in the report.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Assign a project role to at least 2 users in a project. 
 # Remove product access from one of the users.
 # Check the usage for that Project Role.
 # The usage count includes users without product access as well. 

h3. Expected Results

The usage count should only account for users who have product access. 
h3. Actual Results

The usage count includes users without product access, Confusing users Jira Admins.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior other than unassigning project roles from a user before revoking their product access. 

A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: View Usage for Project Role includes inactive users

fields.description:
Currently, the gadget uses the Resolution field to consider an issue as resolved.

Next-Gen Jira Service Desk projects do not use the resolution field, though, so its issues are not counted towards the Resolved trend, causing the gadget to show inaccurate results.

Solution: Update the gadget to use Status Categories as well, as NG JSD tickets are considered resolved when they enter a "green" status.
fields.summary: Update Jira "Created vs. Resolved" dashboard gadget to include Jira Service Desk Next-Gen issues

fields.description:
Please allow scheduling time period for rules to be active. 

This is extremely useful if you have rules that only need to function on the off hours.
fields.summary: Allow scheduling of automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the native filter "Resolved recently" return issues that were never resolved.
The resolved recently filter just return issues order by their issue creation date and doesn't include resolved issues, only open issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Project Issues
# Select Resolved Recently from the available native filters

h3. Expected Results
It should return only resolved issues that were recently resolved (what is recent?)

h3. Actual Results
It returns issues that were recently created and/or that were never resolved.

h3. Workaround
Use the native search Done issues or include green statuses or the resolution statuses to get the proper issue list.
fields.summary: Using the native filter "Resolved recently" return issues that were never resolved

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are facing inconvenience in closing the "Add Gadget" screen when accessing Jira cloud on Windows operating system, when the browser zoom level is set to 100%. The "Close" option is hidden underneath the taskbar.

If the zoom level is decrease to 90%, users can see the "Close" option correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On windows, open Google chrome browser and confirm that the browser zoom level is set to 100%
 # Navigate to a dasboard and try to add a gadget:

_Dashboards > Choose dashboard or create new > Add a gadget_
h3. Expected Results

The "Add gadget" screen pops up with the option to "Close" clearly visible
 
Example on Mac:

!Screenshot 2020-11-02 at 5.29.15 PM.png|width=452,height=296!
h3. Actual Results

The "Close" option of the "Add gadget" screen is hidden under the taskbar on windows:

+At 100% zoom: (Google Chrome)+

!Screenshot 2020-11-02 at 5.22.45 PM.png|width=554,height=340!

+At 90% zoom: (Google Chrome)+

!Screenshot 2020-11-02 at 5.23.00 PM.png|width=551,height=331!
h3. Workaround

Users can set their browser zoom level to 90% to see the "Close" option.
fields.summary: The "Close" button in "Add Gadget" screen is hidden under the taskbar when the browser zoom is at 100% in Windows OS

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new issue view, the ability to see multiple environments on the issue view is not present.
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-29 at 12.57.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 
Clicking on the field reveals the other environment. Opposed to the old view
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-29 at 1.00.43 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to see all the environments on the issue view

h3. Why this is important
The customer wants to see all the environments on the view instead of clicking on the field and then viewing them.
fields.summary: Releases field shows only one environment when integrated with Jenkins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira mail handler will not strip quotes from emails from Outlook which contain color information. For example a like like:
{noformat}
{color:#000000} *From:* Automation for Jira <example@example.atlassian.net>
{noformat}
Would normally match the pattern, however, the color information seems to prevent the match.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1. Send an email from Outlook that has color information as a reply to a Jira comment.

h3. Expected Results

Quotes are stripped
h3. Actual Results

Quotes show up in the reponse.
h3. Workaround

In Outlook, set your email settings to not send quoted emails.
fields.summary: Jira mail handler does not strip quotes if email contains color information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Importing worklogs created by users with a different language set in Jira fails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import a worklog that was created by a user that has changed their locale/language in Jira (e.g. to "Magyar" (Hungarian)) via CSV.

h3. Expected Results
Import completes successfully with no error messages.

h3. Actual Results
Import completes with errors saying "Unable to import worklog" because it did not pass validation.

h3. Workaround
Change the language of the user that created the worklog to English.
fields.summary: Importing worklogs created by Users with different locale fails due to validation errors

fields.description:
Currently, the Regular Expression Check validator on Jira does not support the *Team* (Advanced Roadmap) field and that makes it impossible to set a validator based on the Team selected against a specific value.

The Field required validator also does not support the *Team* field. As a workaround, you can use the Value Field condition instead.
fields.summary: Include the field Team in the options of the Regular Expression Check validator

fields.description:
As a user I want to set issue security levels I don't belong to. 

Currently you are only able to set issue security levels that you belong to, this can be a hinderance when you need to pass a ticket to a different security level than your own. 

This would be very helpfull in a SPOC environment where issues need to be escalated to a more "secure" team (especially usefull when security issues come in)
fields.summary: As a user I want to set issue security levels that I don't belong to.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Jira runs with jQuery version which is susceptible to the following vulnerabilities:

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-11023
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-11022

h3. Steps to Reproduce
-

h3. Expected Results
We should update the version of jQuery to at least version 3.5.0, where these vulnerabilities are no longer present.

h3. Actual Results
Confirm which version of jQuery is using at the moment.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Update jQuery in Jira Cloud to avoid CVE-2020-11022 and CVE-2020-11023

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you attempt to transition an issue via the Slack integration and that transition has a condition that checks that the user is the member of a particular group, the transition will fail and the following error appears in Slack.

!image-2020-10-29-17-58-20-118.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect a Jira project to a Slack channel
 # Edit the workflow for the project and add a condition that checks that the user executing the transition is a member of a particular group.
 !image-2020-10-29-18-02-13-038.png!
 # Add you user account to the group specified in the condition
 # Create a new issue in the project that uses this workflow
 # Via the Slack notification for the issue's creation, attempt to transition the issue using the transition where the group membership condition is present.

h3. Expected Results

If the user executing the transition is a member of the group specified in the condition, the issue is transitioned successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The transition fails and the error message "The requested operation took too long, please try again." is displayed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Workflow Transition via Slack Fails When Group Membership Condition is Present

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a custom field in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project and the name already exists in the company-managed (formerly classic) global custom fields, using the field in a JQL search will break, causing any existing filters using this field to fail.

Note -  The bug also impacts the JQL search in add-ons - e.g  Slack integration, Teams, etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field in the global system settings (company-managed (formerly classic))
# Create a custom field with the same name in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project

h3. Expected Results

The JQL basic and advanced search should recognize these are 2 different fields and continue to function accordingly.

h3. Actual Results

Any existing filters using the company-managed (formerly classic) version of the field will break and going forward you can only query this field by using a different syntax that includes the field type

 !Issue_navigator_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
 !field_type_search.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Simply rename one of the custom fields so there are no duplicates
* Use a different syntax for the field reference in your JQL which includes the field type (eg. "Chocolate[Number]")
* Use the custom field id in the Advanced search instead of the custom field name
fields.summary: JQL breaks with company-managed (formerly classic) custom fields if a team-managed (formerly next-gen) duplicate exists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ability to configure multiple Jira issue layouts for a specific project based on different user groups/roles. 

For example, some users/groups in the project are not supposed to see a specific custom field or an addon but should be able to see the rest of the details in the ticket. As of now, we do not have an option to restrict the fields in the issue view based on the user groups/roles.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any issue and click on "Configure" {quote} !Screenshot 2020-10-29 at 4.07.48 PM.png|thumbnail! {quote}
 # We get an Issue layout which it is common for all the users in the project.

h3. Expected Results

Customers would like to configure different issue layouts for different user groups so that they could hide the fields that are not used by a specific group/role.
h3. Actual Results

Can have one and only Issue layout for a specific issue type.
fields.summary: Ability to configure multiple Jira issue layouts for a specific project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The customer cannot set the 'Description' field on iOS(iPhone and IPAD) and is getting the message "{color:#FF0000}Field description cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown.{color}" The customer wants to remove/hide the field but is not possible as the field is hardcoded. 
The problem doesn't happen on Jira app for Android.
The customer doesn't want to have the field on Jira iOS app screen. 
The Description field was removed from browser UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # We tried uninstalling the current version and installing the latest Jira app(iOS), but the results were the same. (Newest version: v115.x)

Jira V108.x IPAD app
Jira V116.x iPhone app

 # I advised the customer to remove the field from screens and that was still showing it. Two screen schemes had the field removed, but it didn't solve the issue on Jira iOS app.

h3. Expected Results

The description field would be removed/hidden from the screen. 
h3. Actual Results

The description still on the screen and cannot be set. 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround was found.
fields.summary: Cannot hide the 'Description' field on Jira app for iOS

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing Project Gadget on the dashboard with 2 and 3 columns views, issue is not being sorted accordingly to fill all the columns and empty columns randomly appears.


h3. How to Replicate
 # Add new Gadget
 # Add Project
 # Save

h3. Expected Result

Issues fills into all columns towards the bottom
h3. Actual Result

Issues skips columns and shows empty on some rows
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Project gadget for 2 and 3 columns views are broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Now that JRACLOUD-72088 has been released, the csv exports includes extra columns with user ids and user displayName.

For example, for Assignee, we have now a column that informs the user's id and another one that informs the user's display name. The same happens for Reporter or any other user picker type field. Even though you select "current fields" option when exporting issues, the ids are by default automatically included in the csv file.
h3. Suggestion

It would be nice to have the possibility to select/unselect the ids' columns just as it's possible to do with another fields:

!image-2020-10-28-17-07-02-822.png|width=233,height=274!
fields.summary: Possibility to unselect the user id fields when exporting issues to csv

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Multi-line text fields are adding additional information in the issue history tab. This happens in the old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a custom field with the *multi-line text* type;
# Add it to a screen in a project;
# Update this field either in the new or old issue view;
# Check the history in the old issue view and find the change related to the multi-line text field.

h3. Expected Results

Only the text entered will be displayed in history.

h3. Actual Results

In addition to the typed text, the following information is added to the history entry:
{code}<Text> [ {"id":"ari:cloud:jira:<cloud_id>:issuefieldvalue/<id>/customfield_<id>","version":"1"} ]{code}
!Image 2020-10-28 at 4.20.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the new issue view.
fields.summary: Multi-line text fields are adding additional information in the issue history tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When viewing an issue, there are empty spaces that can be used to visualize the issue:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-28 at 09.03.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Auto adjusts the field to the screen size.
 
h3. Why this is important

This should enhance greatly the user experience.
fields.summary: Auto adjustment of the screen when opening an issue
Allow us to edit what information appears on the board page of a business project

fields.description:
Currently, when editing a Select List custom field's options, Jira will load all options. This will timeout when there are thousands of options.

With pagination and searching capabilities, we can avoid these errors.

Workaround:
Use the Rest API:

* https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-customfield-fieldid-option-put
fields.summary: Allow pagination and searching of options when editing a Select List custom field

fields.description:
Currently, Jira only allows us to add a card (smart link) of the file from Bitbucket, but without a preview of the file for all extensions. 

It would be nice to have an option to allow the new view to show the preview.

Currently, it's only possible to add files with a preview for GIPHY, Dropbox and Google Drive, but for our product Bitbucket, there isn't an option.
 !image-2020-10-27-13-45-20-385.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to add Bitbucket repository images as preview in Jira Cloud text fields

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+
Currently URL custom field type in JIRA only supports 255 characters. In many cases, URLs can easily exceed 255 characters. This makes it impossible to save the URLs in the field.

h3. +Suggestion+
Since it's very common for URLs to exceed 255 characters, this field type should support a bigger set of characters.

h3. +Other Workarounds+
Instead of URL field, considering using the followings:
# A multi-line Text field, which supports ~32000 characters, link rendering (via Wiki Style Render) and can be set as Required in Field Configurations
fields.summary: URL Field should support more than 255 characters

fields.description:
Customers would like to have notifications sent via SMS as well.

Hence configuring SMS notification would be much helpful.
fields.summary: Notification via SMS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After CSV import, the *Remaining Estimate* field is not automatically adjusted even though the *Original Estimate* field value exists/has been set.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import some issues using CSV([External system import|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-data-from-a-csv-file/]).
 # Ensure the *Original Estimate* field/column exists with some values(_in seconds_).
 # Leave the *Time Spent* and the *Remaining Estimate* fields/columns blank!
|!image-2020-10-26-22-18-28-896.png|width=267,height=82!|

h3. Expected Results

Once the issues are imported, the *Remaining Estimate* field should be automatically set/adjusted to the value of the *Original Estimate* field(as in this case no *Time Spent* field was set in CSV). 
 !image-2020-10-26-22-29-10-301.png|width=230,height=57!
h3. Actual Results

The issues are imported and the *Original Estimate* field value is set, but the *Remaining Estimate* field does not get adjusted automatically!
 !image-2020-10-26-22-30-57-369.png|width=294,height=73!
h3. Workaround

In the CSV file being imported, the *Remaining Estimate* field/column values need to be specified along with the Original Estimate field/column values.
|!image-2020-10-26-22-19-57-430.png|width=346,height=92!|
fields.summary: After CSV import, the Remaining Estimate field is not automatically adjusted even though the Original Estimate field value has been set.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Keyboard shortcuts for Status dropdown not working
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When you click the status dropdown, You can type in status to filter the dropdown content

h3. Expected Results
Select the Status you are looking for
h3. Actual Results
Not able to search by typing any word or letter from an existing Status of an issue
h3. Workaround
The only workaround available is to select the Status with mouse scrolling and selecting.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts for Status dropdown not working
[] characters are ignored in search even when properly escaped

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Next-Gen projects In the Bread Crumbs on an Issue, the Links to Parent issue cannot be opened in new tab

h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud Next-Gen Projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Next-Gen project Navigate to An issue with a parent issue link in breadcrumbs
# Try to open parent issue in new tab

h3. Expected Results
The parent issue is opened in new tab consistent with other project types

h3. Actual Results
The Link in the breadcrumb only has  # modifier and opens the same issue in the new tab

h3. Notes
As an EXE: 
An issue at the path *{{https://BASE_URL.atlassian.net/browse/NEW-1}}* Will be modified as *{{https://BASE_URL.atlassian.net/browse/NEW-1#}}* when opened in new tab, but WILL NOT redirect to the parent issue when opened in the new tab, It will however redirect to the parent if selected in the same tab.

h3. Workaround
# Open the issue in new tab to get the second window open 
# then select the parent issue breadcrumb in the second tab to redirect to the desired issue in a second tab
fields.summary: Parent Issue Links in bread crumb cannot open in new tab

fields.description:
h3.*Summary*

Attempting to import a value to the dropdown custom field doesn't allows a value via CSV import.

h3.*Steps to Reproduce*
 * Create a next-gen Project
 * Create a dropdown custom field type on the Issue type field
 * Try to import a value to this new "dropdown custom field" via CSV

h3.*Example of a Test Data* -// _test.csv_
{code}
Summary, Description, IssueType, "Program Language"
Issue Test Dropdown, Testing issues, bug, Javascript
{code}

h3.*Expected*
 * Import should be completed with the Custom field having the value imported

h3.*Actual*
*  Import completed with the dropdown custom field having no value and showing as "None"

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dropdown custom field type on next-gen project doesn't allow a value via CSV import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User mention is not correctly converting user name [myname[company]|~accountid:XXXXXXXX] in old issue view, however, it is working as expected in New view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with Full name as *myname[company]*
 # Mention user *myname[company]* in comments through old issue view
 # User name will not be converted correctly

h3. Expected Results

The user name should appear like *myname[company]* in the old view as well.
 refer to the below screenshot

!image-2019-08-27-17-59-53-768.png|width=273,height=53!
h3. Actual Results

The user name is appearing in text format like *[myname[company]|~accountid:5xx* in old-view.

!image-2019-08-27-17-59-31-136.png|width=286,height=49!
h3. Workaround

After selecting a user with a name in this format, it will paste text like this into the editor:
{code:java}
[Display name [Company]|~accountid:abcde]
{code}
Before saving, edit the text to remove the brackets from the display name, but keep the value to the right of "accountid" intact.
{code:java}
[Display name Company|~accountid:abcde]
{code}
When the text is saved, it only looks at the account ID value to work out who you are mentioning. When that text is displayed again, it looks up the display name each time (so that the privacy preferences for the person being mentioned can be observed), and so the correct display name will be shown.
fields.summary: User mention is not correctly converting user name [myname[company]|~accountid:XXXXXXXX] in old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Firefox, share issue dialog is hidden under the backlog view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Jira using Firefox browser
# Open a software project and navigate to backlog view
# Select an issue from the backlog view and click on the *Share* icon shown in the issue details view.
# Watch options window is also hidden


h3. Expected Results
Share issue dialog should be shown completely

h3. Actual Results
Share issue window is hidden behind the backlog view and only a partial window is shown

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to use the Chrome browser.
fields.summary: The Share issue dialog is hidden behind backlog view in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When leaving drill spaces before the carriage return on multi-line comments, the table breaks in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the old issue view
 # Insert a new table in a comment like this and save
{code}|| A || B || C ||
| Stuff | more | etc |
| Blah | Blah | This doesn't render correctly 
because multiline is broken in 
the new issue view |
| Last | line | here |{code}

h3. Expected Results
In both, the old and new issue view, the table renders correctly
h3. Actual Results
On the new issue view, the table gets broken
h3. Workaround

Edit the comment in the old issue view and delete the drill spaces before the carriage return
fields.summary: Drill space before carriage return on new issue view breaks the multi-line comment table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As per the issue summary, work log field returns error when a decimal value is used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to your [user profile|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings] and change your language preference to 'Norsk'. 
# Create a test ticket in your Cloud instance.
# Attempt to log work on the ticket by filling in '5.5 h' (5 hours and 30 minutes).

h3. Expected Results
The work log is created without issues.

h3. Actual Results
Error is returned. Work log is not saved.

!image-2020-01-03-21-28-57-016.png|thumbnail! 

This error can be seen from the network tab.

{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["Arbeidslogg kan ikke være null."],"errors":{"timeLogged":"Ugyldig tidsspenn oppgitt."}}
{noformat}

It translate to invalid value in English.

h3. Workaround

Instead of using decimal values, specify the hours, minutes and seconds instead. '5h 30m' for example.
fields.summary: Work log fields do not accept decimal values when language preference is set to 'Norsk'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Old issue view, if you try to access watchers through the "*. . ."* panel, you'll be directed to another page where it gives you the option to go back to the issue, stop/start watching issue and a list of watchers (but its empty)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue in software project using Old Issue View
 # Add a few watchers to the list
 # Click on the more options button "*. . ."* 
 # Select Watchers

h3. Expected Results

The page should at least show you the list of watchers you can remove or add.
h3. Actual Results

The list of watchers is empty, just states "Watchers" (Screenshots attached)
h3. Workaround
 # Either switch to New Issue View and Manage watchers

OR


 # Use the inline edit by clicking on the Number of watchers in Old Issue View.
fields.summary: Opening Watchers in Old Issue View leads to a faulty page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you delete the Location or uuid Custom Fields, they will appear re-created after a few days & there is no way to fully delete those Fields from a cloud instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Custom Fields page,  !image-2020-03-11-10-36-01-739.png|width=21,height=21! *Jira Settings > Issues > Custom Fields*
 # Delete any of the Location or uuid Custom Fields
 # After a few days, the deleted fields will be re-created

h3. Expected Results

The deleted Fileds will remain deleted
h3. Actual Results

The deleted Fields will be re-created after a few days
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to fully delete Location or uuid Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When having the *jira.issue.editable* property workflow set to *false*, empty fields should not be presented in the issue view when the issue gets into that status.

In the new issue view, these fields are presented for a moment and then disappear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field
# Associate it to your project View screen and add it to the issue layout settings.
# Add the editable workflow property to one of your workflow statuses.
# Create a new issue, leave the custom field empty and move it to the status with the workflow property.

h3. Expected Results

The field should not be presented as it's empty and the issue is not editable, the same way it happens in the old issue view.

h3. Actual Results

The field is presented momentarily and then disappears:
*  [^field-vanish.mov] 

In the above test, the field that disappears is called *Test Field*.

h3. Workaround

This is working as expected, the bug here is that the field should not be presented.
In case you need to edit the field impacted please either remove the workflow property or transition the ticket to a status where it can be edited.
fields.summary: Empty field disappears in the new issue view when having a not editable property in the workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Post function to clear the value of field *Remaining Estimate* does not work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert *Time remaining* in Time tracking on an issue
 # Create a Post function in a specific transition: "_The value of field *Remaining Estimate* will be cleared._"
 # Move this issue using this transition
 # The value of the *Remaining estimate* won't be cleared

 * Video 1: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEuAWQBg]
 * Video 2: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/WnuNDl7b]

h3. Expected Results

The value of the *Remaining estimate* is cleared
h3. Actual Results

The value of the *Remaining estimate* is not being cleared
h3. Workaround

Use the Post function:
 "The *Remaining Estimate* of the issue will be cleared."
fields.summary: Post function to clear the value of field Remaining Estimate does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Link Confluence Pages feature on JIRA issues, it usually allows us to start typing the page name and suggests a list of pages that match with what we are typing. Though, if we are in the new issue view and try to pick one of the suggested pages, JIRA throws us an error saying to check our connection.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to get the new issue view enabled;
# Go to a JIRA issue and use the feature to link a Confluence page;
# Click over one of the suggested pages;
# Click over the *Link* button*

h3. Expected Results
The Confluence page is linked to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA throws us an error saying *_We're having trouble. Check your connection and try again._*

*Notes*:
* After clicking in the *Link* button, a 400 error is generated with response *{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"pageUrl":"addconfluencelink.error.url.invalid"}}*

h3. Workaround
You can either disable the new issue view or paste the Confluence page URL directly in the field.
fields.summary: Cannot pick Confluence pages from the suggestion list in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a subtask is created for a task in the issue filter page, the bread crumb is showing incorrectly. Also when you click the parent task in the breadcrumb the description of the child task is copied to the parent task.

This is happening irrespective of the type of Jira project( Classic, Nextgen, Software, Service Desk, etc). The same pattern can be observed for other cases like Epic/Subtask, Epic/Story, Story/Subtask, etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the issue search filter page in Jira and select an issue.
 # Create a subtask for that issue. The breadcrumb will show incorrectly,
 # Enter some description in the subtask, save it, and click the bread crumb of the parent task.
 # The description of the subtask gets copied to the parent task.

h3. Expected Results
 # When a subtask is created for an issue in the issue search filter page the breadcrumb should show correctly.
 # If any description is saved in the subtask it should be saved in that subtask only and should not get automatically copied to any other issue.

h3. Actual Results
 # Breadcrumb is showing incorrectly when a subtask is created under parent issue in issue filter page.
 # Also, the saved description in subtask is getting automatically copied to the parent task when the breadcrumb is clicked. 

h3. Workaround

The user can create a task and subtasks from other pages like dashboard as the observation is happening only in the issue search filter page.
fields.summary: Creating subtask in issue search page is causing breadcrumb and parent issue to show incorrectly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While trying to link issues, Done issues don't appear when searching and the link is only performed when typing the exact issue key and confirming.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket and move it to Done
# Create another ticket and left it open
# Go in link issues and search for the Done issue name or key

h3. Expected Results
The done issue with its name should appear as all other issues appear while typing their names.
h3. Actual Results
Done issues aren't displayed and it seems that have no issues.
h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround available is to type the exact issue key from the done issue and confirm the link. The issue will be recognized and will accomplish the link.
fields.summary: When trying to link a done issue to another open issue, done issue doesn't appear when searching

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we add a new component when moving an issue returns a 500 error at the final of the procedure.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a JIRA ticket
# In the ... menu, click Move
# Select a project
# Click Next
# Leave the Status selection, and click Next
# In the Components field, enter a new component name
# Click Next
# Click Move

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be moved.

h3. Actual Results

There is an error preventing the procedure to be completed.


h3. Workaround

To get around this, the user can click the back arrow twice. This will take them back to the component screen. There it can be seen that the component was created, the user can select it again, and then next all the way through and move the issue.
fields.summary: Adding a new component when moving issue returns a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a custom field URL and the user paste an web link that contains `*authuser= <useremail>*`on the URL body, if the user clicks on the link, it is opening a new email box with '*mail to:*' instead of opening the web page.

As an example of a URL that contains `*authuser= <useremail>*`, you can use for test the google drive link: [https://drive.google.com/.....authuser=<useremail>.../|https://drive.google.com/.....authuser].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the URL custom field in the issue type screen.
 # Paste the following link on the URL custom field:  [https://drive.google.com/.....authuser=<useremail>.../|https://drive.google.com/.....authuser]
 # Open the URL.

h3. Expected Results

It should open the link posted on the ticket
h3. Actual Results

When clicking in the link, it opens an email box.
h3. Workaround

Create a text field (multi-line) and configure the Wiki render.
fields.summary: Custom fields of type URL interpret any URL with a mail address in it as mailto:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Keyboard Input events interpreted inconsistently during page load and using the Search field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Load any available project and select the Search field which will be available to use and begin typing

h3. Expected Results

Should conserve the words/numbers typed after the project fully loads

h3. Actual Results

Depending on the typed letters/numbers it will use and prompt you to the Shortcuts from the menu.

In this screen recording, I selected the letter "i" to start typing to the search field and It assigned the issue and not wrote the letter to the Search field:

[^Bug_Loading_Project.webm]

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Keyboard Input events interpreted inconsistently during page load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Text Field (read only) appear as editable on the new Jira issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field type Text Field (read only).
!image-2020-07-06-20-47-13-575.png|width=383,height=66!
 # Add this field to a screen.
 # Open an issue on the new Jira issue view with this field.
 # Open it through the new Jira issue view and through the old issue view to see the difference.

h3. Expected Results

This field should not be editable on the new Jira issue view.
!image-2020-07-06-21-01-38-842.png|width=288,height=106!
h3. Actual Results

This field is editable on the new Jira issue view.
h3. Workaround

This is an example that will cover a scenario where you need to fill out with a default value ready only, however, you can adjust it based on your scenario.
 # Create a field  type "*Select List (single choice)*"
 # Set Option 1 as a default value.
 # Associate the field to the *View screen*.
fields.summary: Text Field (read only) appear as editable on the new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Assignee avatars are missing in child issue in Next Gen
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 [^ffAssigneeNextG.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Assignee avatars should be visible.
h3. Actual Results
Avatars are missing for the child issues in next gen.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Missing assignee avatar icon on child issues - Next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Windows, if the name of the project is too long and the issue key has up to 3 digit numbers, the "..." button of issue quick view only work when we position the mouse cursor at a specific point/pixel. The problem only happens in the old issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a project with a long name - up to 23 characters
 2) Create an issue with a issue key with up to 3 digit numbers
 3) Using the old issue view, access the board
 4) In issue quick view, try to click on "..." button
h3. Expected Results

Hover of "..." button should be shown complete.
h3. Actual Results

You need to position the mouse cursor at a specific point of the button in order to be able to click on it and access issue's details:

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/04uYlLqW]

Checking at Browser Dev Tools, it's possible to noticed that the root cause of the problem is the fact that the DIV element that contains the issue key is overlapping the button:

!image-2020-07-23-17-17-37-801.png|width=441,height=168!

The problem only happens when using Windows. When using Mac, this does not happen since the project name is shown in one line and the issue key is shown in another line. 
h3. Workaround

The workaround for this would be to use the new issue view since the problem only happens with old issue view.
fields.summary: When using Windows, in old issue view, the DIV element that contains the issue key is overlapping the "..." button of issue quick view

fields.description:
When you access and issue > Click on three dots (...) > Log work, the cursor doesn't focus on the "Time spend":
 !Screen Recording 2020-08-24 at 03.51 PM.gif|width=631,height=425!

If you scroll down until the time spent field and click on it, the cursor focus on the "Time spend":
 !Screen Recording 2020-08-24 at 03.53 PM.gif|width=632,height=427!
fields.summary: When clicking in log work, cursor is not focused on Time spent field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is converted from one issue type to another using the simple issue type change option in the breadcrumb, validation for required fields is not executed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue type, say Story with a custom text field. This field needs to be 'required' in the field configuration.
 # Convert the Story to a Bug using the simple issue type change option available in the breadcrumb.
 # The Story will get converted to Bug without any prompt for the required custom field value.

h3. Expected Results

When an issue is converted from one issue type to another using the simple issue type change option in the breadcrumb, validation for 'required' custom fields should be executed.
h3. Actual Results

Validation for 'required' fields is not executed when we used the simple issue type change option.
h3. Workaround

Use the Move option in the menu of the ticket to convert one issue type to another. When this option is used, the application prompts the user to enter the value of the required fields.
fields.summary: When an issue is converted from one issue type to another using simple issue type change option in the breadcrumb, validation for required fields is not executed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Text Field (multi-line) custom field values do not refresh when updated on old view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Text Field (multi-line) custom field
# Add to your screen
# update the field in *old view*

h3. Expected Results
updated field value to show on screen
h3. Actual Results
updated field value does not show on screen

The value will be updated only after a refresh.

This issue does not occur on new issue view

h3. Workaround
* update the field in new issue view
* refresh the page to view the updated value
fields.summary: Text Field (multi-line) custom field values do not refresh when updated on old view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The currently selected status option is not read to the user when using JAWS Screen Reader. When assigning requests, there is no indication if the status has been successfully changed to 'In Progress' for example, and navigating back to the button does not read this text either.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the screen reader go to a request;
 # Try to change the status;

h3. Expected Results

The screen reader shows the statuses as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The screen reader doesn't show the statuses.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Status button not readable with JAWS Screen Reader

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the New Issue View, when the  fields are is configured so that the *"FixVersions"* field is set above the "HIDE WHEN EMPTY" line as a *"Context Field"* so that the field is forced to be shown when empty, the field will temporarily load when initially loading an issue but disappear once fully loaded

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the "Fix Versions" field above the "HIDE WHEN EMPTY" line as a *"Context Field"* to a project
# View an issue that does not have a value for FixVersions, as a user that does not have the Resolve Issue permissions
# you can continually refresh the page to see it occur (happens on each page load)

h3. Expected Results
FixVersions field is displayed but empty. As the field is set as a context field and should be displayed regardless of having a value or not

h3. Actual Results
The FixVersions field is temporarily displayed while the page source is loading, and disappears from the view once the screen is fully loaded,  

h3. Note:
If you add a value to the "FixVersions" field as a user with resolve issue permissions, the field is displayed for the alternate user as though it were still added to the "HIDE WHEN EMPTY" section.

h3. Workaround
The user requires the "Resolve issue" permissions for the FixVersions field to display correctly in the current state.  If permissions cannot be altered for the user, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: FixVersion field is shown then hidden when a user without Resolve issue permission views an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Uncontrollable scrolling on issue preview goes down and up very fast.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Decrease the zoom into your browser from 100% to 90%.
# Open the issue preview.
# Scroll down at the end of the issue preview.

* Test made on Chrome.
* I've used a screen set with resolution 1440X900.

h3. Expected Results
* The scroll should stop at the end of the page without scrolling up and down without control.

h3. Actual Results
* When we scroll at the end of the page the scroll will go up and down very fast. This behavior will keep in a loop.
* [Bug's video.|https://share.getcloudapp.com/d5upxrA7]

h3. Workaround
Change the zoom to 100%.
fields.summary: Scrolling on issue preview goes up and down very fast in a loop when we change zoom to 90%

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers report that searching for custom fields that share the same name using advanced searching does not show all of the fields unless they're different field types.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have two or more custom fields named the same and share the same field type.
 # Perform a JQL search with the field name. The autocomplete suggestions only show a single field and not all of the possible fields as before.

h3. Expected Results

Previously the autocomplete suggestions showed the fields with their field IDs for duplicates and all of them could be added in the JQL search. This is the expected behavior.

h3. Actual Results
The completion suggestion shows only one of the duplicated fields with no ID. This leads to JQL searches dismissing duplicate fields unless the CF ID is used.

h3. Workaround
* Perform JQL searches using the custom field ID.
** To obtain the custom field IDs please visit your instance's Custom Field configuration page by navigating to *Jira settings* > *Issues* > *Custom Fields* and find the fields in the list. Then click on the three dots at the end of the row for each field and click Edit details. In the resulting page you'll find the Custom Field ID at the end of the browser's URL.
* Change the names of the custom fields. This will not impact the existing data in the issues that use the field.
fields.summary: Searching for custom fields that share name using JQL does not include all of the fields.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"More" menu doesn't close when item is clicked

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Zoomed into the browser so as to view the *More* options.
* I click on More option and selects the App.
* The drop down is still available even when navigated to the app page.
* Subsequent clicks hides the drop down list. 
* When selected another app, the drop down disappeared. 
|Note: This can be replicated only from App's drop down list.|

h3. Expected Results
The 'More' menu should be disappeared. 

h3. Actual Results

'More' menu is still visible.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "More" menu doesn't close when item is clicked.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There are various *padding-right* and *padding-left* margins in the CSS layout throughout the new issue view, that cause excess whitespace on standard monitor layouts and does not allow the user to utilize the scaling options that are integrated into the code, the scaling gets worse on wider aspect ratio monitors as well as zooming out, in the browser zoom settings, beyond 100%.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# enable New issue view
# Look at any issue from a 16:9 aspect ratio monitor

h3. Expected Results
The margin paddings scale to meet at the very minimum the industry-standard 16:9 aspect ratio 1080p monitor sizes, but 100% scaling prefered for custom monitor solutions or users that prefer to zoom out for extended screen real-estate

h3. Actual Results
As an Example, I am Looking at:
{code}
<div class="sc-iupvsZ chWGEj">
{code}

there is a padding set to scale to 100% but also restricted to a maximum of 1400px:
{code}
padding-right: max((100% - 1400px) / 2, 0px);
{code}

Looks like this:
!Screen Shot 2020-10-15 at 2.47.58 PM.png|thumbnail!

Because of this setting on an industry-standard 16:9 aspect ratio 1080p monitor, there is already an excessive amount of whitespace of 279px for the margin at padding-right (noting padding-left adds an additional 279px of whitespace), and would require scaling up to 1679px to reach the 100% scale setting for this section *noting standard monitor size with default zoom levels at 100%* so this should meet the max 100% scale at this setting

h3.Notes:
# The suggested solution here is to remove 1400px restrictions to all scalable margins
# Alternatively, scale the paddings up 300px to handle at a minimum 16:9 aspect ratio 1080p monitors by increasing all 1400px limitaions to a 1700px restriction

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Margin padding in new issue view restricts view on standard monitor sizes

fields.description:
'*Fix versions*' implies a +bug+ fix.  This field is also used for feature releases as well.  A better title would be simply '*Versions*', which allows a broader interpretation.

A related issue is: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-15554
fields.summary: Change 'Fix versions' to simply 'Versions'

fields.description:
When the text in the pull-down is long, it is cut off in the middle. If the text has the same beginning, they cannot be discerned.

Features to get around this:
① Display all text when the cursor is on it
② Show all text on a new line
 !features.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve display for long text in the pull-down

fields.description:
From a Filter detail page, when you click Details -> 'Edit permissions', the Edit Filter modal is shown.  There is an 'Access' section where you can choose who should have permission to see the filter.  The UI is such that it is very easy to select a new permission without noticing the 'Add' button.  Clicking 'Save' then closes the modal.  This results in no changes to the permissions!  This is a common problem for everyone who edits filter permissions that I have talked to.

 

This screen should be improved with one or two simple changes:
 # Display a warning when closing the modal that says "You have selected new permissions but not added them'.
 # (optional) Make the 'Add' button light up to a different color (e.g. blue) when a permission is selected to make it noticeable.
fields.summary: Filter 'Edit permissions' Edit Filter screen should warn when Access modified but not Added

fields.description:
As a Jira user writing automation rules

I want a rule validated prior to save

So I can create automation more effectively

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * At save, the smart value syntax is validated. Errors are shown next to the rule components.
 * At save, the rule components are validated for missing parts. Errors are shown next to the rule components.
 * Bonus: where smart values can be entered, auto-completion is provided to reduce entry errors.
 * Bonus: where null values can short-circuit smart values, warnings are shown
fields.summary: Validate automation rules before saving

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Message "Smart value is invalid " on Edit issue field action is positioned over the field.
h3. !image-2020-06-26-13-20-00-457.png|width=421,height=226!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Automation Rules and add an action edit fields.
 # Select "*Use smart values*".
 # "Command +" (on Mac) or "Ctrl +" (on Windows) to increase to the browser resolution to 150% ~175%.
 # Start typing a smart value but don't finish.
 # Click out the box, then try to click back on.

Video with error: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/9ZujRZGy] 
h3. Expected Results

The message should be on other position on the page. For example: Below of the field or above.
h3. Actual Results

We will get blocked by the message. 
h3. Workaround
 # Change the page resolution to the message to be positioned to out of the field value.
fields.summary: Message "Smart value is invalid " for dates on Edit issue field action is positioned over the field

fields.description:
I create a lot of rules for Automation in Jira and often I get distracted in the middle of the creation. When I come back to the rule creation I see that the session has been expired and all my progress is lost. Sometimes I lose a lot of configuration since some of my rules are quite complex.

 

Please do something with it, either automatically save drafts or remove the sessions at all. I have no idea why they are there on the first place.
fields.summary: Fix sessions timeouts in the Project Automation screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Want to extract report every week via A4J from Tempo.

 

Currently we can extract report from tempo directly but it would be great if we can retrieve the report from automation and send an email with the report as attachment.
fields.summary: Automating reports from tempo and send emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When customers delete an Organization did not appear a message show directly this error, like a pop-up. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Organization.
 # Add the organization into a rule.
 # Delete the organization.
 # Try to make a change in the rule.

h3. Expected Results

 Appear a message like:

*"The option selected is no longer available. Take a look if you did not delete it."*
h3. Additional information:
video with steps: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/v1urQ1nA]
fields.summary: When customers delete an Organization did not appear a message show directly this error, like a pop-up.

fields.description:
*User Story:*

As a Jira user

I want pre-built automation rules that I can download

So I can learn and rapidly implement common use cases

 

*Acceptance criteria:*
 * Library of common use cases (e.g. clone an epic with its children)
 * Each use case explains the rule, the techniques used, and has a downloadable JSON that can be imported for use
 * Bonus: Users can add comments for learnings about each use case
 * Bonus: Users can submit ideas for new use cases for Atlassian to add
 * Bonus: Users can submit their own rules for consideration of inclusion in the library

 

*Business case:*

The automation rules product that Atlassian acquired from Code Barrel is great... but, it is difficult to learn from the provided documentation or from the various guidance sources available to the Community.  Providing pre-built rules that others can import into their Jira instances will help people learn faster, make team more effective, and to help provide valuable feedback to Atlassian on what people want.
fields.summary: Provide downloadable example automation use cases

fields.description:
A4J when re-opens an issue in next-gen the issue needs to move to the top of the list however currently it is moving based on the ASC order and not based on the recently updated. 

 +*(flag) Note :*+ Manually we can move in any order.
fields.summary: A4J when re-opens an issue in next-gen -> need the issue to move to the top of the list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Conditions for Global Automation Rules are not working when using Next-Gen projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Global Automation Rule
 # Use the following pattern:
Trigger: *Issue transitioned*
Condition: *Issue fields condition*
Action: *Anyone*
 # Run the Rule

!image-2020-07-20-13-07-41-438.png|width=257,height=473!
h3. Expected Results

When the conditions are set, the Automation Rule should perform the action
h3. Actual Results

The Rule is not recognizing when the Condition is true:

!image-2020-07-20-13-11-10-724.png|width=751,height=166!

!image-2020-07-20-13-12-14-510.png|width=391,height=622!
h3. Workaround

Instead of using a Global Rule, the rule needs to be created on each project.
fields.summary: For Global Automation Rules, Conditions are not working for Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When applying the smart value \{{issue.url.customer}}, observed that when an email is sent, it does not update the customer ticket URL. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to send an email with smart value \{{issue.url.customer}}

h3. Expected Results

Email to be received with an URL which contains the customer view of the ticket. 
h3. Actual Results

Empty email received with an URL.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Smart value {{issue.url.customer}} do not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the issue type of an issue is edited through an Automation rule and right after this Edit Issue fields action you have another Edit Issue field action, if the context of this field is applied only to the original issue type, Jira won't be able to update the it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Create a custom field and edit its context to Bug issue type (as an example);
2) Build an Automation rule with the structure below:
* TRIGGER: Issue created
* ACTION: Log action with {{{{issue.issuetype.name}}}}
* ACTION: Edit issue field action, setting issue type value as Bug
* ACTION: Re-fetch issue data
* ACTION: Log action with {{{{ssue.issuetype.name}}}}
* ACTION: Edit issue field action, setting any value to the just created custom field

!image-2020-08-04-16-21-24-345.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

If the fields added to the last Edit Issue Fields are added to the Edit Screen for Bug issue type AND its context is applied to Bug issue type, all the fields should be updated.

h3. Actual Results

Even though the issue type is successfully edited (what we can confirm through the Log Actions), the following error message is shown:

{code}Unknown fields set during edit, they may be unavailable for the project/type. Check your custom field configuration. Fields ignored -{code}

h3. Workaround

To fix this, besides applying the custom field context to the new issue type (in case of the above example, Bug), you'll need to also apply this to the original issue type of the issue (in case of the above example, Task).

!image-2020-08-04-16-26-17-565.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Once a rule edits the issue type and then tries to edit a field, Jira will check if the field context scheme is applied to the original issue type instead of to the new issue type

fields.description: We would like the ability to transmit logs related to Jira Automation rules to third party tools via web-hook. This is an enhancement to the current web-hook functionality and would greatly help in collecting all data in our SIEM tool and will give great visibility across our Jira processes.
fields.summary: Transmit logs related to Automation Rule to a web-hook

fields.description:
h4. Issue Summary

I would like to see as a Jira Administrator an additional condition, such as While loop.
h4. Examples

When I edit or transition issues via Jira Automation, I'd like to receive a single Slack notification that issues are ready for e.g. UAT stage.

For now, if I use If/Else block, there will be notifications sent for each issue in the query.
fields.summary: Add While block condition in Jira Automation

fields.description:
Some customers would like to have the ability to go back in their usage history for global and multi-project automation executions further than the 30 days available at the moment to be able to retrospectively analyze the data.

It could also be helpful to include the ability to export the data in some way for the customer to process it as they see fit.
fields.summary: Automation audit log usage tracking available for more than 30 days
